title: Identify graph - PE vs internuclear separation H2

content.question: Which of the following graphs correctly shows the relationship between potential energy and internuclear separation for two hydrogen atoms?

choices.label: A graph plots Potential energy against Internuclear separation. The graph plots a concave down curve that rises and extends horizontally along a horizontal line depicting Potential energy 0.
A graph plots Potential energy against Internuclear separation. The graph plots a concave up curve that falls and extends horizontally along a horizontal line depicting Potential energy 0.

A graph plots Potential energy against Internuclear separation. A dashed horizontal line depicts Potential energy 0. The graph plots a curve that falls to a minimum through the line before rising with decreasing steepness and extending along the horizontal line.

A graph plots Potential energy against Internuclear separation. A dashed horizontal line depicts Potential energy 0. The graph plots a curve that falls to a minimum through the line, the curve then rise above the line a bit before falling along the horizontal line.

content.answer: A graph plots Potential energy against Internuclear separation. A dashed horizontal line depicts Potential energy 0. The graph plots a curve that falls to a minimum through the line before rising with decreasing steepness and extending along the horizontal line.

skill.text: 5.D: Identify information presented graphically to solve a problem.
